sentence: 2022 WATCH — “The banners and big red video screen all said Dr. Oz, the host gave a rousing introduction and in strode the candidate, MEHMET OZ, to take up the microphone and become the center of attention for more than an hour,” reports AP’s Marc Levy from Newtown, Pa. “Welcome to Oz’s campaign for U.S. Senate, where the celebrity heart surgeon and former host of daytime TV’s ‘Dr.
title: POLITICO Playbook: Your guide through a blizzard of news in Ukraine

sentence: Dr. Mehmet Oz is a heart surgeon, professor emeritus at Columbia University and Republican candidate for the U.S. Senate in Pennsylvania.
author: Dr. Mehmet Oz
title: Dr. Oz: Follow The Science For Domestic Energy Policy

sentence: On the Republican side, Dr. Mehmet Oz, who became famous as a health guru on Oprah Winfrey’s show, is running against about a trillion other hopefuls.

sentence: Oz is out: Dr. Mehmet Oz, a U.S. Senate candidate and host of the long-running "The Dr. Oz Show," was fired from a presidential council, according to a statement released Wednesday by his campaign.

title: OnPolitics: POTUS seeks to lower gas prices by ordering oil from reserves

sentence: “Carpet-bagging” Republican U.S. Senate candidate Dr. Mehmet Oz is being mocked for a video that shows him in a supermarket shopping for ingredients for crudité, and complaining that the ingredients – totaling he says about $20 – are too expensive, and President Joe Biden is to blame.
author: David Badash
title: Mockery Greets Dr. Oz’s Hilarious Campaign Video Of Fake Grocery Shopping (VIDEO)

sentence: Trump’s been feeling some intense backlash for endorsing Dr. Mehmet Oz in a Senate race out of Pennsylvania.

title: Trump’s Poorly-Attended Weekend Rally Included Bragging So Silly That His Own Crowd Began Laughing
